intro: Conospermum glumaceum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf conospermum, is a shrub native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and showy, cone-shaped flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. Conospermum glumaceum is often used in native gardens due to its ornamental value and resilience.
